item.title: The residents of 57 phillipp street n1 5pa and a large group of there friends some on bicycles loitering infront of catherine house on phillipp street smoking canibus drugs shouting laughing loudly using balloons drugs causing intimitading behaviour and nusiance to the community for many years and still hasnt stopped. item.title: Loud clanging manhole cover, 13th July
item.description:
The manhole cover sits in uneven and broken paving and clangs loudly whenever a car drives over it. This upsets the guests in both hotels within the vicinity - and can even be heard from the 8th floor. It sits specifically in front of the Athenaeum hotel but can also be heard by the Sheraton hotel.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Piccadilly, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various items being dumped on both sides of the street, 13th July
item.description:
I think someone needs to take a walk down this street again as it seems it is ok for people to just dump their unwanted items on the pavement. The situation to improve for a while but it looks like we are back to square one again! The street is littered with unwanted and dumped household items right the way down both sides of Riverdale Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riverdale Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree dropping hundreds of fruit, 13th July
item.description:
This tree drops hundreds of fruit all over the pavement that gets trodden on making the pavement slippery. Thousands of wasps are also attracted to the fruit and my 3 SEN children are too frightened to go past. The tree needs cutting down and removing to be replaced with something suitable for a communal space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Tiverton Drive, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown grass and weeds, 13th July
item.description:
Overgrown Grass â€“ Request for Maintenance Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to raise a concern regarding the overgrown grass in [ "the green area on Station Approach/ Millfield Cottages ]. The grass has not been cut for an extended period ( is second year without cutting)and is now excessively high, creating an untidy and neglected appearance. In addition to being unsightly, the long grass may pose safety and hygiene issues, particularly for children and pets. It can also obstruct visibility for drivers and pedestrians. I would be grateful if the council could arrange for the area to be maintained and added to the regular grass-cutting schedule. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to seeing the issue resolved. Yours sincerely resident

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Millfields Cottages, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
